features: Save by the pack: Get a 3-subject spiral notebook 2-Pack with durable plastic covers and 150 sheets of college ruled paper in each; a stock-up staple for your school supplies list
Each notebook contains smooth paper that resists ink smearing & bleedthrough; gel pens, mechanical pencils and highlighters welcome
College ruled notebooks fit more lines per page; with micro-perforated sheets—so the notes you want stay, and the notes you don’t detach easily (tear out page size: 8-1/2" x 11)
3 Hole punch spiral notebook will snap into your 3-ring binder or zip binder for maximum versatility
body.description: Wire-bound notebook is three-hole punched to fit into standard binders. Three dividers keep your subjects separated and offer easy storage for your loose papers. Strong, snag-resistant coil provides sturdy binding and resists catching on backpacks, papers or clothing. Perforated sheets detach easily to keep your book neat and tidy.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us Established in 1919, Oxford Bookstore is the equipped ‘base-camp’ for journeys of the mind offering its the wide range of titles and consistently courteous and informed for close to a century.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good notebooks, good price. Like the inside pockets and that I can use different sections for different parts of the same class and have everything together

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm all set to take notes , refer back to my note and compartmentalize subjects
reviews.reviewText: I love the organization of the notebook and the sturdiness of the paper and its mounts. I Can safely take notes and later return and reference what I've written earlier. The number of pages gives me a lot of confidence that I have room to write freely and without fear of running out of writing space (a whopping 150 pages of writing area). And in addition, the price is superior weighing in at a $1.00 per subject using up to 50 pages per subject I can't lose!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: good price, good size, sturdy folders, paper thin but doesn’t bleed through

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for a college budget
reviews.reviewText: Decided to give these a try and I'm very pleased with them. They have poly dividers with pockets and work efficiently for my classes. I'll be ordering them again when needed

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for teenagers
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my son starting highschool and he loves that they fit in his trapper keeper. The are heavy duty,and the three separate sections are nice also.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are very good notebooks – I will buy more!
reviews.reviewText: I just needed some multi-subject notebooks for a web class I'm taking. These actually have a good quality cover, and the dividers are thick. The pages are college-ruled, and the perforations are far enough away from the spirals to tear them out easily, though I don't usually do that.The spiral rings are of a heavy metal, not that cheap, tightly spiraled metal I've come to expect in notebooks. The spiral is extra wide – I can easily clip two different pens in there if I want.I am very happy with these, and will buy more as long as the price remains this good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kind of expensive, but durable and thick
reviews.reviewText: These notebooks are great for more intense classes. I am a college student and bought these for my physics course, which requires a lot of writing for notes and hw. The paper quality is good. It's durable. I like it and it worked for me. If you're looking for a thicker notebook, I'd recommend this set. It is somewhat expensive, but I think the notebooks were worth it.

Su tamaño es grande por lo que le cabe más cosas a la hoja al momento de escribir y tiene una buena cantidad de hojas como indica la publicacion, resistentes y al usar marcadores no se traspasan por lo que es un otro punto a su favor

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality of product and fast delivery.
reviews.reviewText: Item delivered promptly as described. Thank you and God bless.

reviews.reviewTitle: La calidad de las hojas es magnífica, pero es muy frágil la protección de la libreta
reviews.reviewText: Sé que hay una niña de los plumones buscando este comentario, yo lo busqué y no lo encontré, así que lo hago yo XDPuntos buenos:-Las hojas son súper suavecitas, lo que permite hacer degradados fácilmente.-Las hojas no son gruesas, pero sí resistentes, es verdad que dice que el papel es premium, porque las hojas no se sienten gruesas, a pesar de ello, no traspasan los plumones que uses.-Profundizando un poco más en la cuestión de plumones, puse a prueba 5 marcas de plumones, las que más uso, me faltaron algunas pero estos son los que más uso para degradados, la última marca que probé en la hoja (los plumones beige y café), son unos plumones que compré por mera prueba, pero la calidad de la tinta no es la mejor, ya que se secan demasiado rápido, no permitiendo hacer degradados y tienden dañar las hojas convencionales fácilmente, al probarlos en estas hojas, me quedé súper sorprendida, pues se degradaron perfectamente.-Los lapiceros escriben fluido, estaba usando uno que entre ratos se le iba la tinta en la libreta que antes usaba, pero en esta funcionó bien.-En cada división tiene por ambos lados si no me equivoco, una tipo carpetita o sobrecito, para que metas notitas.Puntos malos:-Lo más importante, es que la pasta (o lo que debería ser la pasta XD) de la portada es de plástico y la contraportada es de un cartón no tan fuerte, lo que hace que se sienta de mala calidad la libreta por fuera, no es apta si tienes muchos movimientos bruscos, porque es fácil de doblar la libreta y no por cuestión de las hojas, sino el problema es lo que debería proteger la libreta, que como dije, es de plástico.-Algo que puede ser contraproducente de las hojas suaves, es que precisamente como sirven para degradar plumones, quiere decir que dejan fresca la tinta por cierto tiempo, así que es de tener cuidado, de no pasar la mano luego luego de haber subrayado, o de haber escrito con algo que suelte mucha tinta.-Se siente un poco la escritura con lapicero, a lo que me refiero es a que se siente cierto relieve cuando sientes la parte trasera de donde escribiste, ya que como mencioné, las hojas no son tan gruesas.En general es una libreta que tiene potencial porque sus hojas son maravillosas, sólo que a la vista general y al tacto, no se ve de calidad.
Son libretas un poco más anchas que una profesional, de buena calidad, nos gustaron mucho.
